original: des na lung gi dngos po rnams //ðŸ”½rtogs pa po yi rnam 'gas kyang //
analyzed: des na lung gi dngos po rnams // rtogs pa po yi rnam 'gas kyang //
translated: Therefore, the things of scriptureðŸ”½are not known by the one who understands.

original: med na mi 'byung grags min na //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung grags min na //
translated: If they are not known, how can the meaning

original: de dag las don nges gang yin //
analyzed: de dag las don nges gang yin //
translated: be ascertained from them?

original: skye bo mi shes pa lung gi tshad ma des kun nas bstan pa'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bo mi shes pa lung gi tshad ma des kun nas bstan pa'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand the meaning that is indicated by the authoritative statements of scripture,

original: tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: tshol bar byed de /
translated: people seek to understand it.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa ni bstan pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa ni bstan pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the correct understanding of reality does not depend on scripture.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi skyes bu rnam par 'byed par mi nus pa'i phyir /ðŸ”½'dod pa'i don yod pa nyid med par tshig rnams kyi 'jug pa mthong ba mi shes pa ni 'khrul pa ma mthong ba can gyi skyes bu dag gi tshig la yang ci don ji lta ba can nam /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi skyes bu rnam par 'byed par mi nus pa'i phyir / 'dod pa'i don yod pa nyid med par tshig rnams kyi 'jug pa mthong ba mi shes pa ni 'khrul pa ma mthong ba can gyi skyes bu dag gi tshig la yang ci don ji lta ba can nam /
translated: Since one cannot distinguish the person who possesses the supramundane qualities,ðŸ”½one sees that words can be used even when the desired meaning does not exist. The ignorant, who do not see the errors of such a person, will doubt whether the words of such a person have a meaning that corresponds to reality

original: ma yin zhes the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin zhes the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: or not.

original: des na 'dis ni 'ga' zhig gi tshig gis cung zad kyang nges par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni 'ga' zhig gi tshig gis cung zad kyang nges par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that anything is ascertained by the words of some.ðŸ”½And this:

original: 'di yi / de phyir de ni log na yang //
analyzed: 'di yi / de phyir de ni log na yang //
translated: Therefore, even if that is reversed,

original: dngos po med pa grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po med pa grub mi 'gyur //
translated: nonexistence is not established.

original: lung ni thams cad kyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lung ni thams cad kyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because scripture has all things as its object,

original: dngos po yod na mi slu bas 'di 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po yod na mi slu bas 'di 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: it engages when things exist, and it is nondeceptive.

original: de log pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pas med pa bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pas med pa bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, nonexistence is established by nonapprehension, which has the characteristic of the reversal of that.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'di ni thams cad kyi yul can nyid yin na yang dngos po med par mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'di ni thams cad kyi yul can nyid yin na yang dngos po med par mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not so, because even though scripture has all things as its object, it does not engage when things do not exist.

original: de las khong du chud par 'dod pa'i grub pa med do zhes bshad zin to //ðŸ”½nges med nges pa'i 'bras bu can //
analyzed: de las khong du chud par 'dod pa'i grub pa med do zhes bshad zin to // nges med nges pa'i 'bras bu can //
translated: And it has already been explained that there is no establishment of what is to be understood from that.ðŸ”½Nonapprehension is not established,

original: mi dmigs pa ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mi 'grub po //
translated: because it is uncertain, and has a certain result.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gsum log tu zin kyang bskal pa'i don dag med par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gsum log tu zin kyang bskal pa'i don dag med par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if the three kinds of valid cognition are reversed, it is not certain that things that are distant are nonexistent.

original: rig byed tshad ma dang ni 'gas byed smra //ðŸ”½khrus la chos 'dod dang ni rigs smra dregs //
analyzed: rig byed tshad ma dang ni 'gas byed smra // khrus la chos 'dod dang ni rigs smra dregs //
translated: Water is pure, and the Vedas are the means of knowledge.ðŸ”½The self is the enjoyer, and the body is the object of enjoyment.ðŸ”½The self is permanent, and the world is beginningless.ðŸ”½The self is the agent, and the self is the one who experiences.ðŸ”½The self is the one who sees, and the self is the one who hears.ðŸ”½The self is the one who smells, and the self is the one who tastes.ðŸ”½The self is the one who touches, and the self is the one who thinks.ðŸ”½The self is the one who remembers, and the self is the one who doubts.ðŸ”½The self is the one who desires, and the self is the one who hates.ðŸ”½The self is the one who aspires, and the self is the one who resolves.ðŸ”½The self is the one who goes, and the self is the one who comes.ðŸ”½The self is the one who sleeps, and the self is the one who wakes.ðŸ”½The self is the one who is happy, and the self is the one who is sad.ðŸ”½The self is the one who is afraid, and the self is the one who is confused.ðŸ”½The self is the one who is angry, and the self is the one who is delighted.ðŸ”½The self is the one who is born, and the self is the one who dies.ðŸ”½The self is the one who is bound, and the self is the one who is liberated.

original: sdig pa gzhom phyir gdung ba rtsom zhes pa //
analyzed: sdig pa gzhom phyir gdung ba rtsom zhes pa //
translated: The self is the one who is born, and the self is the one who dies.ðŸ”½The self is the one who is bound, and the self is the one who is liberated.ðŸ”½ Translation: The Vedas are valid, and the creator is proclaimed.

original: blun po shes rab 'chal pa'i rtags lnga yin //
analyzed: blun po shes rab 'chal pa'i rtags lnga yin //
translated: Water is pure, and the Vedas are the means of knowledge.ðŸ”½The self is the enjoyer, and the body is the object of enjoyment.ðŸ”½The self is permanent, and the world is beginningless.ðŸ”½The self is the agent, and the self is the one who experiences.ðŸ”½The self is the one who sees, and the self is the one who hears.

original: rig pa chen po sa'i steng ma lus pa na smra ba'i glang ngo che'i spyi bo gnon par mdzad pa'i seng ge phyogs ma lus par snyan par grags pa can /ðŸ”½dpal chos kyi grags pas sbyar ba las /
analyzed: rig pa chen po sa'i steng ma lus pa na smra ba'i glang ngo che'i spyi bo gnon par mdzad pa'i seng ge phyogs ma lus par snyan par grags pa can / dpal chos kyi grags pas sbyar ba las /
translated: The self is the one who smells, and the self is the one who tastes.

original: tshad ma rnams 'grel gyi le'u dang po'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams 'grel gyi le'u dang po'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The self is the one who touches, and the self is the one who thinks.ðŸ”½The self
